message.content: This question tests knowledge about the sensory abilities of different animals. The Southern cave crayfish lacks the ability to see by sensing light. Option (B) is incorrect because lobsters have compound eyes that can detect light. Option (C) is incorrect because cod have well-developed eyes for vision. Option (D) is incorrect because salmon also have well-developed eyes and rely on light for their vision.

To answer this question, we need to know which animal lacks the ability to see by sensing light. The Southern cave crayfish is known to lack visual pigment cells and is therefore blind. Option (B) is incorrect because lobsters have eyes and can see. Options (C) and (D) are also incorrect because both cod and salmon have eyes and are capable of seeing.
